domain_knowledge: Spending and saving behavior can be used as proxies for Time preference of an individual.

datasets.name: nls_bmi_processed.csv
datasets.description: This dataset is from the National Longitudinal Survey of Youth (NLSY79) includes variables such as gender, age, income, savings behavior, BMI, and racial background.

raw.name: GENDER
raw.description: Gender of the Respondent (MALE or FEMALE)

raw.name: AGE
raw.description: The age of the respondent in the year 1989

raw.name: AGE_2
raw.description: Square of the age of the Respondent

raw.name: INCOME
raw.description: The income of the respondent in the year 1989

raw.name: DISSAVED
raw.description: A boolean variable that equals 1 if the respondent took more money out of than put into savings and equals 0 otherwise

raw.name: SAMESAVE
raw.description: A boolean variable that equals 1 if the respondent's savings level did not change or the respondent had no savings, and is 0 otherwise

raw.name: BMI
raw.description: Body mass index of the respondent calculated using the standard formula using the height and weight of the respondent using the height of 1985 and weight of 1989

raw.name: BLACK
raw.description: A boolean variable that indicated if the respondent belongs to the black race or not

raw.name: HISPANIC
raw.description: A boolean variable that indicated if the respondent belongs to the hispanic race or not

main.text: Time preference is positively associated with Body Mass Index in Hispanic men with coefficients for no change in savings level being 1.5799 (p-value: 0.000) and coefficient for having withdrawn more money from savings than they had put in being 0.9826 (p-value: 0.038)

workflow:
OLS Regression on data with GENDER="MALE" and HISPANIC=1
With DISSAVED and SAMESAVE as independent variables
and BMI as dependent variable

queries.true_hypothesis: Time preference is positively associated with BMI in Hispanic men with coefficients for no change in savings level being 1.5799 (p-value: 0.000) and coefficient for having withdrawn more money from savings than they had put in being 0.9826 (p-value: 0.038)
queries.question: How does time preference impact BMI in Hispanic men?
